title: Order by Silence
outcome: The Directorate, fearing spiraling unrest, enacts a total shutdown of all civilian digital communications. In the ensuing silence, underground analog communication networks emerge using fragments of leaked conversations between Halden and a Council Harmonist, fracturing citizen loyalties and fueling silent resistance against Council control.

events.description: The Directorate initiates a full shutdown of civilian digital communication in Stenograd, allowing only Council-sanctioned broadcasts and emergency messages to transmit.
Analog communication networks emerge in silence: brief, handwritten notes and coded symbols spread through neighborhoods, circumventing BCI observation.
Snippets of encrypted audio—fragments of a past dispute between Halden and a prominent Harmonist—surface on these networks, fueling suspicion and silent gatherings against current leadership.
Citizens stage a coordinated silent protest; thousands line the streets in stillness. Trust in official communications plummets, and the Council struggles to reassert control.
